title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest on January 24, 2025

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: January 24, 2025
Location: Bonita Springs, FL
Suspect: Sabrina Deanna Coyne, 34
Incident Summary: Deputies responded to a residence in Bonita Springs after a homeowner was awakened by a loud crash and banging on the front door. Surveillance footage allegedly showed Coyne throwing a brick—engraved with "first date" and the couple’s names—through the home’s window. When questioned, Coyne denied throwing the object and claimed to live there, but the ex-boyfriend stated she had moved out six months prior. She was arrested and charged with criminal mischief and throwing a deadly missile into an occupied dwelling.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the scene on January 24, 2025
Interacted with Sabrina Deanna Coyne during the investigation.
Took Coyne into custody.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: On December 14th, 2024
Location: Walmart, 3400 Hartzdale Drive, Camp Hill, PA 17011
Suspect: Blair Louise McGuire
Incident Summary: On December 14, 2024, at 3:43 PM, Lower Allen Township Police responded to Walmart for a report of a stolen credit card. The victim stated that she noticed her card was missing after receiving alerts for two unauthorized purchases totaling $47.17 at the Sheetz on Simpson Ferry Road. Walmart surveillance footage showed a female suspect picking up the credit card from the floor and leaving the store in a red truck. Sheetz surveillance confirmed the same female using the card. The suspect was later identified as Blair McGuire, and charges were subsequently filed, leading to her arrest.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the initial report at Walmart on December 14, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest on November 17, 2024

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: November 17, 2024
Location: North Side Commons, 401 W. Jackson Street, York, PA 17403
Suspect: Anaiya Monae Watkins
Incident Summary: At approximately 11:40 PM, Spring Garden Police responded to a report of an assault at North Side Commons. Upon arrival, officers met with York College Campus Police, who reported a physical altercation between two students, with one claiming that her iPhone had been stolen. Officers proceeded to Manor North to speak with Anaiya Watkins regarding the stolen phone. Watkins returned the phone but became verbally aggressive during the interaction. As a result, she was taken into custody and transported to Central Booking. She was later charged with disorderly conduct and resisting arrest.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the initial assault report at North Side Commons.
Interacted with Watkins at Manor North.
Took Watkins into custody and transported her to Central Booking.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest on September 7, 2024

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest on September 7, 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: September 7, 2024
Location: 50 Block of South High Street, West Chester, PA 19380
Suspect: Dylan Novak, 21, of Avondale, PA
Incident Summary: At approximately 1:45 PM, a West Chester Borough Police officer was flagged down by employees of a business regarding a person refusing to leave the property. Officers made contact with the individual, identified as Dylan Novak. When officers attempted to take him into custody, Novak resisted arrest, physically fought officers, and broke a window on the property. Two officers sustained injuries during the struggle. Novak was eventually subdued, arrested, and charged with aggravated assault, resisting arrest, criminal mischief, and related offenses. He was transported to the West Chester Police Department for processing before being taken to Chester County Prison.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the initial call for assistance.
Attempted to place Novak in custody.
Were involved in the physical altercation.
Transported Novak to the police department and Chester County Prison.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun
